content:
TITLE: Retrofit API Call Execution in Kotlin
DESCRIPTION: Syncs data using Retrofit to handle API requests and responses within the OfflineFirstNewsRepository. Requires Retrofit library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/docs/ArchitectureLearningJourney.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
RetrofitNiaNetwork.getNewsResources
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Initializing Data Sync with WorkManager in Kotlin
DESCRIPTION: Initiates a WorkManager job to synchronize repositories when the Android app starts, ensuring data freshness across app layers. Requires Android WorkManager library.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/docs/ArchitectureLearningJourney.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
Sync.initialize
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Kotlin Flows for News Resource Streaming
DESCRIPTION: Combines user data and news resources into a stream, updating UI state based on data availability. Prerequisite: Implement Kotlin Coroutines and Flow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/docs/ArchitectureLearningJourney.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
GetUserNewsResourcesUseCase.invoke
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Data Synchronization with Room Database in Kotlin
DESCRIPTION: Handles the reconciliation of remote and local data using a Room database, with error handling using exponential backoff strategies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/docs/ArchitectureLearningJourney.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
OfflineFirstNewsRepository.syncWith
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Transforming Database Models using Kotlin Flow Operators
DESCRIPTION: Intermediate operators transform database model data for consumption by other app layers. Dependencies include Kotlin Flow.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/docs/ArchitectureLearningJourney.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
OfflineFirstNewsRepository.getNewsResources
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Declaring Project Dependencies with Gradle Notation - Gradle - Configuration
DESCRIPTION: This snippet lists the external libraries and versions to be included in the project, using the "group:artifact:version" syntax. It covers necessary runtime, standard libraries for Kotlin, coroutines support, serialization, Google play services, dependency injection, and annotations. Each dependency entry indicates a requirement that must be satisfied for the project to build and function correctly, although actual inclusion in the build depends on the context where this list is applied (typically in a dependencies block or dependencies.gradle file). No explicit parameters are provided; developers should ensure the referenced repositories are available. Limitations: snippet does not demonstrate dependency scope (e.g., implementation, api). Inputs are static strings specifying group, artifact, and version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/dependencies/prodReleaseRuntimeClasspath.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: Gradle
CODE:
```
javax.inject:javax.inject:1\norg.checkerframework:checker-qual:3.12.0\norg.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-android-extensions-runtime:1.9.22\norg.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-parcelize-runtime:1.9.22\norg.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib-common:2.1.10\norg.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib-jdk7:1.9.0\norg.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib-jdk8:1.9.0\norg.jetbrains.kotlin:kotlin-stdlib:2.1.10\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-coroutines-android:1.10.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-coroutines-bom:1.10.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-coroutines-core-jvm:1.10.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-coroutines-core:1.10.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-coroutines-guava:1.10.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-coroutines-play-services:1.10.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-datetime-jvm:0.6.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-datetime:0.6.1\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-serialization-bom:1.8.0\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-serialization-core-jvm:1.8.0\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-serialization-core:1.8.0\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-serialization-json-jvm:1.8.0\norg.jetbrains.kotlinx:kotlinx-serialization-json:1.8.0\norg.jetbrains:annotations:23.0.0\norg.jspecify:jspecify:1.0.0
```

----------------------------------------

It includes various AndroidX components, Jetpack Compose libraries, networking libraries, image loading libraries, and Kotlin-related dependencies. Each line follows the format 'group:artifact:version'.

TITLE: Defining Android Package Information
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the core package details for the Android application, including its unique name, version code, version name, platform build information, and the SDK versions it was compiled against.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
package: name='com.google.samples.apps.nowinandroid' versionCode='8' versionName='0.1.2' platformBuildVersionName='15' platformBuildVersionCode='35' compileSdkVersion='35' compileSdkVersionCodename='15'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Declaring Required Android Permissions
DESCRIPTION: Lists the permissions the application requires to access protected parts of the system or other apps. Permissions include internet access, network state checking, sending notifications, preventing the device from sleeping, receiving cloud messages, accessing install referrer, running at boot, running foreground services, and a custom permission.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
uses-permission: name='android.permission.INTERNET'
uses-permission: name='android.permission.ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE'
uses-permission: name='android.permission.POST_NOTIFICATIONS'
uses-permission: name='android.permission.WAKE_LOCK'
uses-permission: name='com.google.android.c2dm.permission.RECEIVE'
uses-permission: name='com.google.android.finsky.permission.BIND_GET_INSTALL_REFERRER_SERVICE'
uses-permission: name='android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED'
uses-permission: name='android.permission.FOREGROUND_SERVICE'
uses-permission: name='com.google.samples.apps.nowinandroid.DYNAMIC_RECEIVER_NOT_EXPORTED_PERMISSION'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Android SDK Version Requirements
DESCRIPTION: Defines the minimum and target Android SDK versions required for the application to run. 'minSdkVersion' specifies the lowest API level the app supports, while 'targetSdkVersion' indicates the API level the app was designed and tested for.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
minSdkVersion:'21'
targetSdkVersion:'35'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Core Application Attributes and Launch Activity
DESCRIPTION: Sets the default application label and icon, and identifies the main entry point activity ('com.google.samples.apps.nowinandroid.MainActivity') that is launched when the user starts the application.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
application: label='Now in Android' icon='res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
launchable-activity: name='com.google.samples.apps.nowinandroid.MainActivity'  label='' icon=''
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Android Application Icons for Different Densities
DESCRIPTION: Defines the application's launcher icon resource ('res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml') for various screen densities (120dpi to 65534dpi). Using an adaptive icon (anydpi-v26) ensures the icon displays correctly on different Android versions and launcher shapes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
application-icon-120:'res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
application-icon-160:'res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
application-icon-240:'res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
application-icon-320:'res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
application-icon-480:'res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
application-icon-640:'res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
application-icon-65534:'res/mipmap-anydpi-v26/ic_launcher.xml'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Supported Android Screen Sizes and Densities
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the range of screen sizes (small, normal, large, xlarge) and densities the application supports. 'supports-any-density: 'true'' indicates the application can handle various screen pixel densities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
supports-screens: 'small' 'normal' 'large' 'xlarge'
supports-any-density: 'true'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Specifying Required and Implied Android Hardware Features
DESCRIPTION: Declares hardware features used by the application. It explicitly requires 'android.hardware.faketouch' for compatibility with devices that emulate touch input, which is also listed as an implied default feature for all apps.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
feature-group: label=''
  uses-feature: name='android.hardware.faketouch'
  uses-implied-feature: name='android.hardware.faketouch' reason='default feature for all apps'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Declaring Optional Android Library Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Lists Android libraries that the application can use if available on the device but are not strictly required for its core functionality. These include libraries for ad services and window extensions for foldable or multi-display devices.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
uses-library-not-required:'android.ext.adservices'
uses-library-not-required:'androidx.window.extensions'
uses-library-not-required:'androidx.window.sidecar'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Localized Android Application Labels
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the display name of the application ('Now in Android') as it should appear in different locales. This extensive list ensures the application name is presented correctly for a wide range of language and regional settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Supported Native Code Architectures
DESCRIPTION: Indicates the native CPU architectures (ABIs) for which the application includes compiled code (e.g., C/C++ libraries). Support includes common ARM (64-bit and 32-bit) and x86 (32-bit and 64-bit) architectures.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
native-code: 'arm64-v8a' 'armeabi-v7a' 'x86' 'x86_64'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Supported Android Screen Densities
DESCRIPTION: Specifies the screen densities (in dots-per-inch, dpi) for which the application may provide specific resources. This includes standard densities like 160 (mdpi), 240 (hdpi), 320 (xhdpi), 480 (xxhdpi), 640 (xxxhdpi), as well as lower (120) and a generic high-density placeholder (65534).
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
densities: '120' '160' '240' '320' '480' '640' '65534'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Supported Android Locales
DESCRIPTION: Enumerates the extensive list of locales (language and regional variations) that the application provides resources for, including a default ('--_--') and numerous specific language codes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/app/prodRelease-badging.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
locales: '--_--' 'af' 'am' 'ar' 'as' 'az' 'be' 'bg' 'bn' 'bs' 'ca' 'cs' 'da' 'de' 'el' 'en-AU' 'en-CA' 'en-GB' 'en-IN' 'en-XC' 'es' 'es-US' 'et' 'eu' 'fa' 'fi' 'fr' 'fr-CA' 'gl' 'gu' 'hi' 'hr' 'hu' 'hy' 'in' 'is' 'it' 'iw' 'ja' 'ka' 'kk' 'km' 'kn' 'ko' 'ky' 'lo' 'lt' 'lv' 'mk' 'ml' 'mn' 'mr' 'ms' 'my' 'nb' 'ne' 'nl' 'or' 'pa' 'pl' 'pt' 'pt-BR' 'pt-PT' 'ro' 'ru' 'si' 'sk' 'sl' 'sq' 'sr' 'sr-Latn' 'sv' 'sw' 'ta' 'te' 'th' 'tl' 'tr' 'uk' 'ur' 'uz' 'vi' 'zh-CN' 'zh-HK' 'zh-TW' 'zu'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Gradle to Enable Jetpack Compose Compiler Metrics and Reports (bash)
DESCRIPTION: This Bash command demonstrates how to build the Android project in release mode using Gradle, while enabling Jetpack Compose compiler metrics and reports through project properties. It requires the Gradle wrapper (./gradlew), the relevant Compose plugins configured in the build, and sets two properties to true. Execution generates report files under build/compose-reports and metric files under build/compose-metrics. Appropriate permissions and dependencies in the project setup are necessary for successful report generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
./gradlew assembleRelease -PenableComposeCompilerMetrics=true -PenableComposeCompilerReports=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Referencing Convention Plugin Paths in Kotlin
DESCRIPTION: File paths to the main convention plugins used in the NowInAndroid project for configuring Android, Kotlin, and Compose options across different module types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/android/nowinandroid.git/blob/main/build-logic/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: kotlin
CODE:
```
nowinandroid.android.application
nowinandroid.android.library
nowinandroid.android.test
nowinandroid.android.application.compose
nowinandroid.android.library.compose
```
